items.title: Name mangling
items.content:
#â€‹649 â€” July 27, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Hono + Htmx + Cloudflare: A New Stack? â€” A lot of people seem to be jumping on htmx lately as an alternative to the complexity of frameworks like React, but what if you want to keep using JSX? Hono is a (vaguely Express-like) Web framework targeting edge function use cases and includes middleware for rendering JSX. Yusuke gives a quick example of how all this can come together with Cloudflare Workers and D1 for a simpler, full-stack JSÂ experience.

Yusuke Wada

Shrinking VS Code with Name Mangling â€” Thereâ€™s a fair bit of JavaScript in VS Code but the team has managed to reduce the size of the shipped code by almost 4MB without actually doing any deleting or refactoring thanks to a new â€˜name manglingâ€™ build step. This is a great read on how the team approached things and got itÂ working.

Matt Bierner

New Course: The Hard Parts of UI Development â€” Develop an under-the-hood knowledge of UI development by learning techniques such as data binding, UI composition, templating, virtual DOM and its reconciliation, and hooks, all fromÂ scratch!

Frontend Masters sponsor

Microsoft TypeChat: An Approach for Type-Safe LLM Responses â€” A new project with some prominent names attached (the designer of C# and PM for TypeScript, for starters) that demonstrates the excitement within MS for large language models (LLMs). TypeChat aims to work around the problem of LLMs outputting hard-to-parse natural language and to direct such output into a predictable, typed form.

Hejlsberg, Lucco, Rosenwasser et al.

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ¦ React/Redux's Dan Abramov is leaving Meta. Having achieved so much and reaching a point where he feels ready to move on, Dan is departing Meta but will remain on the React team as an independent thirdÂ party.Â ğŸ’™

  • ğŸ“˜ The Concise TypeScript Book is, unsurprisingly, a guide to using TypeScript. More surprisingly, it's all on GitHub and free to read. Hurrah.

  • Tixy is an interactive page for learning logic, math and expressions by solving puzzles using a visual grid. It starts off very simply, but gets elaborate quickly. This is a neat way to pick up some of the skills needed forÂ Dwitter.

  • JSPlayground is a new Web-based JavaScript sandbox tool.

  • Is the term 'Jamstack' finished? Brian Rinaldi wonders.

ğŸ‰ RELEASES:

  • Bun 0.7 â€“ The JavaScriptCore-based alternative JS runtime adds (experimental) Vite support, Web Workers support, and includes a --smol option to run in memory constrained environments (with a significant memory reduction shown off in theÂ post).

  • Astro 2.9 â€“ The 'zero JS by default' framework adds experimental support for view transitions and more.

  • Neutralinojs v4.13.0 â€“ Lightweight cross-platform desktop app framework.

  • Remix 1.19 â€“ Modern full-stack JS framework.

  • Node.js v20.5.0 (Current)

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

ğŸ’› Â 'Good Code is Like a Love Letter to The Next Developer Who Will MaintainÂ It' â€” â€œThe beauty of our creations, however, is not judged solely by the elegance of our algorithms or the efficiency of our code, but by the joy and ease with which others can build upon ourÂ work.â€

Addy Osmani

More practically, Addy also tells us to stick to 'boring architecture' for as long as possible.

ğŸ“… Â React Native EU Conf with Guenther Steiner: Book LastÂ RegularÂ Tickets

Callstack sponsor

How to Build a GPT-3 App with Next.js, React, and GitHub Copilot â€” GitHub doesn't often run tutorials on its blog, but they appear keen to promote the idea of a modern Copilot-oriented developmentÂ process, and this certainly shows off some of theÂ potential.

Kedasha Kerr (GitHub)

Upgrading an Ancient React App
Jeffrey Carl Faden

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

a11y-dialog 8.0: A Lightweight, Accessible Way to Create Dialogs â€” Supports alert dialogs as per WAI-ARIA, nested dialogs, and provides both a DOM and JavaScript API. Thereâ€™s a live CodeSandbox demo you can playÂ with. v8.0 no longer supports IE, if that's important toÂ you.

Kitty Giraudel

Mapkick.js: Interactive Maps in One Line of JavaScript â€” Supports Mapbox and MapLibre. It also comes in Python and Ruby variants targeting server-side rendered useÂ cases.

Andrew Kane

RxDB - Local Database For JavaScript Applications â€” With RxDB you can build realtime applications with great performance that even works when your users areÂ offline.

RxDB sponsor

PLJS: JavaScript Language Plugin for Postgres â€” PLV8 is the â€˜go toâ€™ extension to use JavaScript within Postgres, but this QuickJS-based variant, from the same creator, is more compact, easier to maintain, and may be enough forÂ yourÂ needs.

Jerry Sievert

Twin 3.4: Use Tailwind Classes in CSS-in-JS Libraries â€” Twin v3 introduced full Tailwind plugin support, and v3.4 adds a new SolidJS preset as well as styled-components 6Â support.

Ben Rogerson

Praxis: An iOS Browser That Blocks JavaScript â€” Well, thatâ€™s certainly one way to fight back against prompts, modals, and battery sapping scripts, but it wonâ€™t work with everyÂ site..

Arnold Sakhnov

Spectacle 10: A React and JSX-Based Presentation Library â€” Got a presentation coming up? Build your decks with JSX, perhaps. GitHub repo.

Formidable

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior Software Engineer (Frontend Lead) â€” Come lead Emerge's web platform, used by teams like DoorDash, Square, Dropbox & Airbnb (our stack: Next.js, React, TS,Â Vercel).
ğŸ›¸ Emerge Tools

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

  • gridstack.js 8.4
    â†³ Framework agnostic dashboard layout and creation.

  • amqp-client.js 3.0
    â†³ AMQP 0-9-1 client for both Node and browser (via WebSocket).

  • FingerprintJS 4.0
    â†³ Browser fingerprinting library. No longer open source.

  • MQTT.js 5.0 â€“ MQTT client for Node and browser.

ğŸ™ˆÂ Taking things too far..

We'll support anyone who's keen to reduce the amount of needless JavaScript that goes over the wire (ğŸ‘‹ Astro or Qwik) but sometimes, just sometimes, you can go too far with the endeavor to almost comedic effect:

ğŸ˜± Â Implementing Tic Tac Toe with 170MB of HTML â€” Unsurprisingly, the demo (which weâ€™ve not linked to here) brought my browser to a crashing halt, but itâ€™s fun to see a developer take on the challenge of using Chromeâ€™s support for popovers and the state of said popovers along with a huge pile of HTML to handle a game of Tic Tac Toe. Donâ€™t repeat this in production,Â folks..

Gareth Heyes

items.title: The tale of how static typing came to JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹648 â€” July 20, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

pkg-size: Find the True, Current Size of an npm Package Without Leaving Your Browser â€” A beautifully designed site that can show you the true size of an npm package (including dependencies) using the actual packages which are 'installed' in a browser-based WebContainers-powered environment. Hiroki has ğŸ¦ a Twitter thread where he explains more about how itÂ works.

Hiroki Osame

TypeScript and the Dawn of Gradual Types â€” From GitHubâ€™s ReadME project comes a thorough journalistic take on how static typing made it into the JavaScript world, what TypeScript offers, some alternative approaches, and the possibility of adding type annotations to JavaScriptÂ iself.

Mike Melanson (GitHub)

Create a Real-Time Multi-Host Livestream with Amazon IVS â€” Amazon Interactive Video Service (Amazon IVS) enables developers to create dynamic video experiences, such as collaborative livestreams with multiple hosts. Click here to learnÂ more.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) sponsor

Storybook 7.1: The Workshop for Building UI Components â€” v7.1 introduces in-app onboarding for your newest team members, zero-config styling support for Tailwind, MUI, styled-components and MUI, Vue 3 source snippets, andÂ more.

Storybook Team

Five Inconvenient Truths about TypeScript â€” A brief dose of reality for a world seemingly obsessed with TypeScript: â€œIf you want to get into TypeScript, donâ€™t think you can leave JavaScript behind. It will find you, and it will getÂ you.â€

Stefan Baumgartner

ğŸ‰ RELEASES:

  • Fresh 1.3 â€“ The Deno web framework. Plugins can now inject routes and middleware into apps, there's Deno.serve support, and you can create async route components.

  • Downshift 8.0 â€“ Primitives to build WAI-ARIA compliant React autocomplete, combobox & select components.

  • Node.js v18.17.0 (LTS) â€“ Node 18 gets the Ada 2.0 WHATWG URL parser.

  • Fastify 4.20 â€“ The fast, low overhead web Node.js framework.

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • The Promise.withResolvers proposal has progressed from stage 2 to 3 at TC39, as has the array grouping proposal, as well as source phaseÂ imports.

  • ğŸ—£ The folks on Hacker News discussed why the site isn't being indundated with links to new JavaScript frameworks recently. Has React 'won'? Has AI stolen the limelight? Or is a JavaScript revolution quietlyÂ brewing..?

  • ğŸ‘´ğŸ» A blog post from 1996 popped up telling us about the newest JavaScript features in Netscape 3.0 â€“ definitely a blast from the past. Say hello to the typeof operator!

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

'How We Generate JS and Python SDKs from a Canonical RustÂ SDK' â€” PostgresML is an extension that adds machine learning functions into Postgres. Its team loves and prefers Rust but most of its users are using JavaScript or Python. What to do? Simultaneously write multi-language libraries usingÂ Rust..

Silas Marvin (PostgresML)

ğŸ’¡ Psst.. if you use Postgres at all, we have a Postgres newsletterÂ too!

Updating Code with jscodeshift â€” TypeORM is an ORM for Node that introduced some breaking changes requiring the author to update lots of calls in his code. A perfect time to use a â€˜codemodâ€™ to automate the job. Even if you donâ€™t use TypeORM, this post might give you some ideas for other places to use such anÂ approach.

Clinton Blackburn

AI-Proofing Your Career For Tomorrow: Free Session by InterviewÂ Kickstart â€” Discover Your AI Career Path (AI/ML vs Data Science). Take an informed decision: Insights from FAANG+ AI/ML Engineers. Register for a freeÂ session.

Interview Kickstart sponsor

How React 18 Improves App Performance â€” If youâ€™ve not entirely kept up with how things have changed or developed in React with regards to concurrent rendering, transitions, Suspense, and even React Server Components, this is a fantastic review and primer to get up to speed on how React's newer features dramatically help withÂ performance.

Lydia Hallie (Vercel)

300ms Faster: Measures Taken to Reduce Wikipedia's Total Blocking Time (TBT)
Nicholas Ray

On the Origins of JSX and Why It Exists
Hristiyan Dodov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

wavesurfer.js 7: Audio Waveform Player â€” If youâ€™re creating a podcast player, audio experience, or anything where seeing an interactive audio waveform could be useful, check this out. GitHubÂ repo.

katspaugh and contributors

TOAST UI Grid: A Customizable Grid Control for the Web â€” A powerful MIT-licensed grid-style control for the display, editing, and management of data. It comes from the same folks as TUI Editor and TUI Calendar and while itâ€™s happy on its own, there are wrappers for Vue and React too. GitHubÂ repo.

NHN

Breakpoints and console.log is the Past, Time Travel is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, andÂ more.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Pines: A Library of UI Components for Alpine.js and TailwindÂ Projects â€” Includes sliders, tooltips, accordions, modals, and others. The CSS-only components are usable in any Tailwind project while the ones that require JS are designed for use withÂ Alpine.js.

devdojo

YouTube.js 5.5: A Wrapper Around YouTube's Private API â€” One of those things you'd expect to be quickly blocked somehow, but it's 18 months old, so... ğŸ˜† The fun isn't just for Node or Deno users â€“ it'll work in the browser if you can proxy the requests through your ownÂ server.

LuanRT

Eruda 3.0: A Console for Mobile Browsers â€” If youâ€™re in a situation where you have no access to DevTools, you can add Eruda to your page and it provides a sort of virtual devtools you can use from any browser, including onÂ mobile.

LiriLiri

Reagraph 4.10: WebGL Graph Visualization Library forÂ React â€” Hereâ€™s a basic code example. This weekâ€™s release adds support for three dimensional clustering. GitHubÂ repo.

REAGRAPH

brotli-wasm 2.0: A Brotli Compressor and Decompressor â€” Covers both Node and the browser by means ofÂ WebAssembly.

HTTP Toolkit

Pacquet: A New, Experimental Package Manager for Node â€” From a Node.js core member, no less.

Yagiz Nizipli

  • Shareon 2.2
    â†³ Lightweight, stylish 'share' buttons for social networks.

  • Helipopper 8.0
    â†³ Tooltips and popovers for Angular. (Demos.)

  • Ink 4.3
    â†³ React for interactive command-line apps.

  • ğŸ“… React Calendar 4.4

  • â™– React Chessboard 4.0

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

ğŸµÂ Thank you for the music..

Chip Player JS: Browser-Based MIDIs, MODs and Game Music â€” The creator of this site has, like me, a fascination with old digital music â€“Â MIDI files, trackers, and the like. Rather than keep an old computer running, he decided to build a browser based music player for suchÂ files.

Matt Montag

P.S. If you're looking for something specific to listen to, the music by famed Norwegian tracker Jogeir Liljedahl is well worth a try â€“ particularly Overture or Guitar Slinger. Or how about Donkey Kong Country's dreamy Aquatic Ambience? It's striking how trackers managed to squeeze so much down into a few hundred kilobytes by the heavy reuse and manipulation of samples.

Matt Montag 


P.S. If you're looking for something specific to listen to, the music by famed Norwegian tracker Jogeir Liljedahl is well worth a try â€“ particularly Overture or Guitar Slinger. Or how about Donkey Kong Country's dreamy Aquatic Ambience? It's striking how trackers managed to squeeze so much down into a few hundred kilobytes by the heavy reuse and manipulation of samples.

items.title: htmx in 100 seconds
items.content:
#â€‹647 â€” July 13, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Driver.js: Create On-Page Tours, Highlights, and Contextual Help â€” A no-dependency, vanilla JavaScript library for putting together page tours and contextual help systems. The project is a few years old but has just been entirely rewritten and gained numerous enhancements, plus a huge lick of paint. There are lots of examples to checkÂ out.

Kamran Ahmed

Component Party: A Rosetta Stone of UI Library Code Examples â€” A comparison of different frameworks (like React, Vue, Svelte, Angular, Ember, etc.) by way of simple code snippets covering variousÂ tasks.

Mathieu Schimmerling

Test and Validate APIs Effectively and Efficiently â€” Gain access to several API testing tools and features that help you automate repetitive tasks, stay organized, and build robust workflows to ensure your APIs remain reliable andÂ performant.

Postman sponsor

Prettier 3.0: Now Powered by ES Modules â€” The popular multi-language code formatter gets a big upgrade with a refactoring to ES modules making up the biggest change (though it can still be used as a library via CommonJS). One side effect is Prettier now supports ESM-based plugins and async parsers which means some necessary changes for Prettier pluginÂ developers.

Sosuke Suzuki

Crockford on Plain Old JavaScript and the DOM â€” Over the years, Douglas has asked us to only use the good parts of JavaScript, to â–¶ï¸ stop using JavaScript, and now he suggests abandoning â€œthe librariesâ€ to instead work with the DOM directly. Lea Verou ğŸ¦ picked up on this story and said this suggestion still isn't very practical for most web apps as ofÂ 2023.

Douglas Crockford

ğŸ‰ RELEASES:

  • Ember 5.1 â€“ The ambitious JS framework that'll never give up takes a big step into the TypeScript world with stable TypeScript support and types-a-plenty.

  • p5.js 1.7 â€“ Processing-inspired JavaScript library for creative coding. v1.7 introduces WebGL 2 and frame buffer support.

  • Prisma 5.0 â€“ A popular ORM for Node.js and TypeScript. 5.0 boasts significant performance improvements.

  • typescript-eslint 6.0

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • obj?.prop = value; The optional chaining assignment proposal advanced to stage 1 at TC39 this week. (Explanatory slidedeck.)

  • Popular YouTube channel Fireship explains â–¶ï¸ htmx in 100 seconds â€“ well timed, since htmx is seeing a huge amount of fresh interest. And if you're wondering who the mastermind behind Fireship is, Honeypot has put up â–¶ï¸ a short documentary aboutÂ him.

  • The folks at Sandworm have shared a look at the state of the npm registry including lots of trivia, history, and stats on how many packages there are, as well as the most commonly used keywords inÂ packages.

  • Google shares a case study on performance of scroll-driven animations using its new browser based API versus 'classical JavaScript techniques.' Unsurprisingly it's much faster running away from the main thread, and the spec remains in draft forÂ now.

  • npm will now check the linked source commit and repo when you view a package's provenance information on npmjs.com and warn you when said provenance cannot be established.

  • GitHub is rolling out a beta of passwordless, passkey based authentication onÂ GitHubâ€¤com.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Useful Functions for a (Deno) HTTP Server â€” You could think of HTTP in a functional way with requests going in and responses/results going out. The author explores Denoâ€™s new Deno.serve function and how both it and the /x/http_fns functions can provide a more functional approach to common HTTPÂ tasks.

Jollytoad

Testing the Dark Scenarios of a Node.js App â€” Several examples of often overlooked things you should be testing. What happens when a service times out, code is mutating things it shouldnâ€™t, or you have zombie processes milling around? These are some of the â€˜dark scenariosâ€™ it's not too difficult to prepareÂ for.

Yoni Goldberg and Raz Luvaton

The 2023 State of the API Report Is Here â€” The State of the API is the world's largest survey and report on APIs, with findings from over 40K developers and APIÂ professionals.

Postman sponsor

Creating Randomized Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Patterns â€” Nintendo's new Zelda game uses repeated, geometric patterns as part of its aesthetic. This post looks at how to recreate such motifs with SVG andÂ JavaScript.

Paul Hebert

5 TS Compiler Flags You Should Include in Your Project's Config
Igor Konovalov

Deploying a Fastify and Vue 3 Static Site to Heroku
Liran Tal

Getting Started with Vector Databases in Node.js
Valeri Karpov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

MDX Editor: A Rich Markdown Editor React Component â€” A Lexical-powered Markdown editor for React apps that supports code blocks, tables, and more. The live demo shows off most of what you need toÂ see.

Petyo Ivanov

Meet Your New Favorite Teammate: Cody, the AI Coding Assistant â€” Code faster with Cody, the only code AI that knows your entire codebase, like the pair programmer you alwaysÂ wanted.

Sourcegraph sponsor

electron-vite: Next Generation Electron Build Tooling â€” Fish and chips, Bert and Ernie.. some things are just better together, and so it goes with the Electron desktop app framework and the Vite frontend toolkit. Thereâ€™s also an Electron Vite Boilerplate app to kick off a new appÂ with.

Alex Wei

ğŸ“Š Â Vizzu 0.8: A Library for Animated Data Visualizations â€” Making data visualizations is reasonably easy, but animating them is harder. Vizzu steps in to help you create animated data stories and explorations. There are lots of showcases and examples toÂ peruse.

Vizzu Inc.

ğŸŠ Â Putout: A Configurable, Babel-Based Linter and Code Transformer â€” Provides typical linting functionality with ESLint and code transformation with Babel, but distinguishes itself by being prepared to make â€œmore drastic code transformationsâ€ than other tools. Itâ€™s not the most popular option but it makes a good case for itself in its thoroughÂ README.

coderaiser

Standardized Audio Context: Cross-Browser Web Audio API Wrapper â€” A side effect-free abstraction over a subset of the Web Audio API that works reliably across all mainstreamÂ browsers.

Christoph Guttandin

Kanel: Generate TypeScript Types from Postgres â€” It works by inspecting a live database and outputs code you can add to a TypeScript project and use with something like Knex â€“ GitHubÂ repo.

Kristian Dupont

React Authentication â€” Without Complexity

Userfront sponsor

  • Boa 0.17 â€“ An experimental Javascript lexer, parser and compiler written in Rust that can be embedded into other projects â€“ it now has a module system.

  • Octokit.js 3.0
    â†³ Official GitHub SDK for browsers, Node, and Deno.

  • Release It! 16.1
    â†³ Automate npm package publishing and versioning.

  • zlFetch 6.0
    â†³ Convenience wrapper around the Fetch API.

  • Terminalizer 0.10
    â†³ Record your terminal and generate animated GIFs.

  • eslint-plugin-prettier 5.0
    â†³ Prettier, but as an ESLint rule.

  • Preact 10.16 â€“ 3KB React compatible alternative.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

ğŸ©Â Homer would approve

donut.js: donut.c, But in JavaScript â€” donut.c, dating from 2006, is a donut-shaped C program that, when run, animates a spinning ASCII text donut on the screen. Hereâ€™s a fresh and hot JavaScriptÂ variant!

Evan Zhou

items.title: CommonJS, we love you, we love you not..
items.content:
#â€‹646 â€” July 6, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

What's Next for JavaScript: New Features to Look Forward to â€” A reassuring and high level look at just what goes into making JavaScript better over time, along with some of the new things about to appear or still making their way through the arduous TC39Â process.

Mary Branscombe (The New Stack)

Mary has followed up this piece with Beyond Browsers: The Longterm Future of JavaScript Standards which goes into more depth on JavaScript's ongoing developments in the world of servers and edge functions.

ğŸ¥ Â Remotion v4.0: Create Videos Using React â€” A powerful framework for creating videos from code using React and JavaScript. v4 is such a big update they â–¶ï¸ recorded a keynote to show itÂ off.

Jonny Burger

A Brief Primer to Engineering Efficiency â€” Software teams are dealing with many changes and budget cuts, yet still have the same delivery expectations. So, how do you keep up? ğŸ¤” The answer: invest in efficiency. Get ahead of the game with this brief on engineeringÂ efficiency.

Sleuth sponsor

'CommonJS is Hurting JavaScript' â€” An interesting take on Nodeâ€™s default module system, its history, its shortcomings, and the trickiness of managing both CommonJS and ES modules at once. It's perhaps no surprise the folks at Deno would like to see CommonJS disappear, but...

Andy Jiang (Deno)

.. the Bun team, on the other hand, say au contraire and tell us CommonJS is not going away! They explain CommonJS's plus points and why Bun is adding support forÂ it.

RELEASES:

  • TypeScript 5.2 Beta â€“Â Just a month after the final release of 5.1, too. using is the headline feature and the release post goes into fantasticÂ detail.

  • Node.js v20.4.0 (Current) â€“ Node gains an interesting new 'mock timers' feature for writing more reliable and deterministic tests for time-dependentÂ functionality.

  • Vite 4.4 â€“ The frontend toolkit updates to esbuild 0.18, adds experimental Lightning CSS support, and there are new starter templates for Solid and QwikÂ users.

  • Billboard.js 3.9 â€“ A popular D3-based chart library. (Demos.)

  • Deno 1.35 â€“ The alternative JS runtime makes Deno.serve() (its Web server API) stable, and improves npm and NodeÂ compatibility.

  • Bun 0.6.13

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • Jack Herrington sat down with Redux and Redux Toolkit's maintainer, Mark Erikson, to â–¶ï¸ discuss what's next for Redux and Redux Toolkit?

  • ğŸµ Spotify has introduced a TypeScript SDK for its Web API.

  • A little update from the Svelte team on the complete overhaul of their official site, hot on the heels of Svelte 4.0's release. It's a great time to be a SvelteÂ developer.

  • The folks at Imgâ€¤ly released the code for a system that can remove the backgrounds of images directly in the browser â€“ more info.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

In Defence of DOMContentLoaded â€” A solid explainer on measuring browser events and the use cases for DOMContentLoaded (and related events) in particular. "The DOMContentLoaded event fires once all of your deferred JavaScript has finishedÂ running."

Harry Roberts

Breaking Up with SVG-in-JS in 2023 â€” â€œSVGs in JS have a cost and SVGs do not belong into your JS bundle.â€ A look into why you shouldnâ€™t have SVGs in your JS bundle and better techniques for using them fromÂ JSX.

Jacob GroÃŸ

Move from Datadog to Axiom with Our New Migration App â€” Logging reimagined means Axiomâ€™s plans start at $25/mo for 1tb of data. Stop sampling, getÂ Axiom.

Axiom sponsor

An Introduction to the View Transitions API â€” The experimental View Transitions API offers an easier way to animate between DOM states and even between page loads. Hereâ€™s a look at how to use this progressiveÂ enhancement.

Craig Buckler

JavaScript Gom Jabbar â€” In the Dune universe, a â€œgom jabbarâ€ is a poisonous needle used in an eponymous test where people are subjected to intense pain. Somehow this is turned into a metaphor for painful JavaScript experiences.. ğŸ˜

Alex Kotliarskyi

â–¶Â Â The JavaScript Hype Cycle and React Burnout â€” Aaronâ€™s idea? Pick something that works for you, avoid the hype cycle, and, perhaps, donâ€™t use things that arenâ€™t at least a yearÂ old.

Aaron Francis

ğŸ“… That 'year old' thing is an interesting idea. We should introduce a section where we look back at things from a year ago and if they're still going.. ğŸ˜…

How to Consume a Paginated API using Async Generators
James Sinclair

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

MathLive: A Web Component for Math Input â€” A web component that provides an interface for editing formulas. It uses LaTeX-style typesetting to keep things looking good. GitHubÂ repo.

Arno Gourdol

Starlight: A Documentation Site Builder from Astro â€” React has Docusaurus, now Astro has Starlight. Being Astro, itâ€™s framework agnostic and you can extend it with React, Vue, Svelte, Solid, etc. You get site navigation, search, internationalization, code highlighting, dark mode, and more out of the box. GitHubÂ repo.

Starlight

Monitor, Test and Debug your APIs with APIToolkit

APIToolkit sponsor

mdsvex: A Markdown Preprocessor for Svelte â€” The homepage is a minimal, but cute, demonstration, but the docs are where the meatÂ is.

pngwn

rrule.js: Work with Recurrence Rules for Calendar Dates â€” iCalendar is a data format for representing calendars and schedules, and RRULE is its way to define recurring events. rrule.js allows you to work with such rules, and has an amazing â€˜playgroundâ€™ style homepage to show itÂ off.

Jakub Roztocil

copy-text-to-clipboard: Copy Text to Clipboard in Modern Browsers â€” Pretty simple but will save you a little messing around with the browserÂ API.

Sindre Sorhus

  • TinyBase 4.0
    â†³ Reactive data store for localâ€‘first apps.

  • Cross Fetch 4.0
    â†³ Universal WHATWG Fetch API for Node, browsers and React Native.

  • Sortable 2.2
    â†³ Makes any table with class="sortable"Â sortable.

  • Escodegen 2.1
    â†³ AST to ECMAScript code generator.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

ğŸÂ And one for luck..

Joplin: An Open Source Note Taking and To-Do App â€” Essentially an open source Evernote, complete with numerous client apps (desktop and mobile) and a server side supporting synchronization across cloud services. GitHubÂ repo.

Laurent Cozic

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
